japanese: 五輪旗の右端の輪っかって何色だったっけか？
english: What color is the far right ring on the Olympic flag?

japanese: 顧問は学長を推戴し、本会の重要事項に関し諮問に応じる。
english: The consultant, who is under the authority of the Chancellor, gives the committee advice on important questions.

japanese: 戸籍上の縁は切れても、昔日の絆はそのままだ。
english: Our connection may be cut on paper but the bonds of old remain as they were.

japanese: 古賀、あんたの半生で一体何があったの？
english: Koga, what on earth happened in your youth?

japanese: 言わずもがなのことを言ってしまった。
english: I should not have said that.

japanese: 言わずもがなだ。
english: You know what it is.

japanese: 言うまでもないことだが捜索は徒労に終わった。
english: It goes without saying, but the search ended in vain.

japanese: 現物がこっちから行っちゃえば、雪花ちゃんも四の五の言わないって。
english: I'm saying that if the real thing comes to her, Sekka won't have anything to grumble about.

japanese: 現段階ではその問題についてコメントできません。
english: At this point, I'm unable to comment on that problem.

japanese: 現代の日本で錬金術といえば、比喩的にしか使われない。モラルや羞恥心と無縁の政治屋や宗教家が、不正な手段でカネもうけをするときに。
english: In present day Japan, "alchemy" is only used metaphorically; to refer to improper means of making money by politicians or religious hucksters with no morals or shame.

japanese: 現在はＴＥＴＲＡの操作的な意味を 「すべての消費可能なリソースを消費する」と与えている。
english: At present "consume all consumable resources" is assigned as the operational meaning of TETRA.

japanese: 現在、参加を希望する方々がとても多く、状況によって１ヶ月先まで満席になっております。
english: At present a very great number of people are seeking to participate and, depending on circumstances, up to a month ahead is fully booked.

japanese: 現在、韓国と日本の政府との間で、教科書問題が両国間にかかわる重要な問題へと発展しています。
english: At present the text book issue between the Korean and Japanese governments is developing into a significant problem affecting both countries.

japanese: 元気な声がそのまま返ってくる。杞憂だったかな・・・。
english: Her cheerful voice responded just like that. Guess I was worrying over nothing...

japanese: 厳しいトレーニングに、彼は音を上げた。
english: He gave up under the severe training he faced.

japanese: 元はと言えば、健ちゃんが鈍ちんなのがいけないんだからね～っ。
english: When you think about it, it's all Kenny's fault for being so obtuse.

japanese: 鍵のいらない暗証タイプには、お好きな番号を設定できるフリーダイヤル式と、あらかじめ番号が設定済みの固定式とがあります。
english: For code-type locks that don't need a key, there are 'free dial' systems where you can set any number you like, and fixed types where the number is set in advance.

japanese: 見日はレークジェニーバをかたどって池を造った。
english: Ken'nichi made a pond in the shape of Lake Geneva.

japanese: 見渡すと、既に船はかなり沖の方にいた。
english: Looking around the boat was already quite far out in the open sea.

japanese: 研究というほどでも・・・素人の道楽ですよ、おはずかしい。
english: It can hardly be called research... just an amateur's hobby, I'm ashamed to say.

japanese: 憲法の規定に従い衆院の議決が参院に優越する。
english: Under the Constitution, the lower chamber's resolutions override those of the upper chamber.

japanese: 件の七不思議の話。調べてきてくれたのでしょう？
english: This is about the case of the "seven mysteries". Did you investigate it?

japanese: 結婚生活がうまく行っていない方は結婚式の時におごそかに神の前に誓った、夫婦の誓約を思い出してみましょう。
english: And to the people whose married life is not going well, let's remember the marriage covenant sworn solemnly before God at the wedding ceremony.

japanese: 決めること決めちゃって、その後は二手に分かれるよ？
english: Let's decide what needs to be decided, then let's split into two teams, OK?

japanese: 決して悠長な仕事ではない。
english: This certainly isn't a job where you can take it easy.

japanese: 劇の批評はおしなべて好評だった。
english: Almost all of the reviews of the play were favorable.

japanese: 軽くひと泳ぎした僕は、水から上がってプールサイドに腰を下ろす。
english: After a light swim, I came up from the water and sat down on the poolside.

japanese: 警棒で空をなぐりつけ、よろめいて体勢をたてなおしたガードマンは、自分に向かって突進してくる金網づくりのクズカゴを見た。
english: The guard's truncheon hit air. Off balance, he regained his posture to see a metal-mesh rubbish bin flying towards him.

japanese: 警察が医療事故の立件に消極的だ。
english: The police are reluctant to pursue criminal charges in medical cases.

japanese: 恵子はいつもグースカ寝てるじゃないか。食事を楽しんで貰いたい気持ちは分かるが、そんな慌てるな。
english: Don't you always sleep like a log yourself? I can understand your feelings of wanting them to enjoy their meal but don't be in such a rush.

japanese: 恵子さんが良くてもみんなが納得しないんです。後で俺がドヤされるんだから。
english: Even if that's alright with you nobody else will accept it. I'll get shouted at afterwards so...

japanese: 恵子が手際よく食器を重ねて、シンクへ運んでゆく。
english: Keiko deftly piles up the cutlery and takes them to the sink.

japanese: 恵子、バタートーストあるか。
english: Keiko, any buttered toast?

japanese: 啓子さんの問題はうわさで聞き知った。
english: I learned about Keiko's problem from gossip.

japanese: 啓介さんは、このお屋敷で、ずっとお勉強しているんです。いわゆるホームスクーリングという形ですね。
english: Keisuke has always studied in this mansion. That style known as 'home schooling', right?

japanese: 兄弟とも「妻と飛行機の両方は養えない」との理由で、生涯独身を通した。
english: Saying they could not support both a wife and an airplane, the two brothers therefore spent their lives as bachelors.

japanese: 空腹はメンタル的に良くない。
english: An empty stomach doesn't help on the mental front.

japanese: 掘っ建て小屋でもいいから自分の家が欲しい。
english: I want my own house, even if it's a shack.

japanese: 空気を遮断して火を消した。
english: The air was blocked off, extinguishing the fire.

japanese: 苦虫を噛みつぶしたような顔で、綾乃ちゃんは舌打ちした。
english: Ayano tutted, making a sour face.

japanese: 苦しかったらギブアップして、お姉さんのお願いを聞きなさいっ。
english: If you can't take it, give up and do what I, your older sister, asked of you.

japanese: 金衡１ポンドは１２オンスである。
english: One pound troy weighs 12 oz.

japanese: 近年では、クエーサーの観測を応用したVLBIと呼ばれる方法やGPSによって、プレートの絶対運動も理解され始めている。
english: In recent years, with a method called VLBI that uses quasar observations, and by GPS we have begun to understand the absolute movement of tectonic plates.

japanese: 錦あやなす木々で山が染まっていた。
english: The mountainside was ablaze with the autumn colors of the trees.

japanese: 勤務中なのに職員の目を盗んでインターネットに耽溺する。
english: Even during work, I secretly indulge my Internet addiction.

japanese: 勤務時間内で余裕のある時にはＩＰ関連の勉強などができます。
english: You can study IP related material during work hours when you have time to spare.

japanese: 教室でどうどうとタバコをすう高校生たちとそれを注意できない教師たちは罰を受けることになります。
english: High school students who flagrantly smoke in class and the teachers who can't caution them will be punished.

japanese: 恐ろしい光景に彼は戦慄した。
english: He shuddered at the terrible scene.

japanese: 教科書問題や歴史認識、靖国神社への首相の参拝などで、日中関係に波風が立っている。
english: Such things as the textbook controversy, lack of recognition of historical events, and the prime minister's worshipping at the Yasukuni Shrine have caused discord with China.

japanese: 怯んだのを相手に気取られてはいけない。
english: You mustn't let the other person notice that you flinched.

japanese: 強面の変なセールスだったらすぐアタシを呼びなさいね、追い返してやるから。
english: If it's an aggressive strange salesman, then call me right away. I'll chase him off.

japanese: 競馬で稼ぐ！ありえないほど儲かる競馬ノウハウ集！
english: Earn money on the races! Know-how collection on horse racing will have you raking it in!

japanese: 魚は遠火でゆっくり、こんがり焼き上げます。
english: The fish is baked slowly till browned over a not-too-close fire.

japanese: 距離で１００メートルといったらかっきり１００メートルである。
english: For distances, if 100 meters is said it's exactly 100 meters.

japanese: 居酒屋で変なおっさんにからまれた。
english: I was given a hard time by a strange guy at the tavern.

japanese: 牛乳の流れを素早く止め、牛乳が固まるまで約３０分間静置する。
english: Quickly stop the flow of milk, leave to stand for approximately 30 minutes for the milk to solidify.

japanese: 旧システム用に書かれたソフトとの上位互換性を保つのは大切です。
english: It is important to maintain backward compatibility with software that was written to run on the former system.

japanese: 急激にかりかりした鳥皮が食べたくなった。
english: I suddenly got a craving to eat some crisp roast chicken skin.

japanese: 宮殿は物々しい警戒ぶりだった。
english: The palace was heavily guarded.

japanese: 休み中に置き勉してると没収されるんだよな。
english: If you leave your textbooks at school during the break, they'll get confiscated.

japanese: 休みの前などは少し羽目を外して飲むのだが、杜仲茶割りで飲むと二日酔いが全くない。
english: I usually cut loose a bit and drink plenty before a day off work, but if my drinks are cut with tochu tea, then I get absolutely no hangover.

japanese: 脚韻と平仄が漢詩の基本的ルールとなっています。
english: Rhyme and meter form the essential rules of Chinese poetry.

japanese: 疑問が氷解しました！
english: My doubts have been cleared up.

japanese: 起こるべくして起こった事故だった。
english: It was an accident that was waiting to happen.

japanese: 貴職らにとっては重要なことです。
english: This is an important thing for all of you.

japanese: 貴女に大怪我をさせられたせいで、この子の夏休みの予定は全部おじゃんになってしまったんですよ？
english: Thanks to you getting him badly injured, all of that kid's summer plans came to nothing!

japanese: 汽車に揺られつつ、２時間ほどいい気持ちでうとうと眠った。
english: I slept drowsily with a good feeling for about 2 hours, while rocked by the train.

japanese: 気になってならない俺は思わず、目の前の学生に聞いてしまった。
english: It was on my mind so much that I unthinkingly asked the pupil in front of me.

japanese: 帰国子女があの組の中に溶け込むのは難しいよ。
english: It's difficult for returnees to blend in with that class.

japanese: 既成概念を壊そう！
english: Let's break stereotypes!

japanese: 机の上に写真立てに入った子どもの写真と結婚式の写真があった。
english: There were framed pictures of a child and a wedding on top of the desk.

japanese: 基本的に、不器用な人だから・・・それが崇っているんだろう。
english: She's basically clumsy so ... I guess she looks up to that sort of thing.

japanese: 基本はアスカがシンジをいじめる。で、たまにキレたシンジがアスカを襲う。その時のアスカはやけにしおらしい。
english: The key is that Asuka abuses Shinji. So, rarely, Shinji flips and assaults Asuka. Then Asuka is surprisingly meek.

japanese: 顔をべろべろ舐めるな。わはは。止めろよ。
english: Don't slobber over my face! A-ha-ha-ha. Stop it!

japanese: 韓流ドラマブームに便乗して、韓国の製品を売る業者が増えた。
english: Taking advantage of the popular boom in Korean drama, workers selling Korean goods have increased.

japanese: 関わり合いになったら、ドスどころかチャカが出てきそうだ。
english: Mess with them, and they won't just pull shivs on you; they're probably packing heat.

japanese: 鑑定をする時には、絵の真贋や保存状態等を調べる為、持ち主に本物を借りたりしなければいけなくなる。
english: When it is appraised, in order to check the authenticity and state of preservation of the painting, the real thing has to be borrowed from its owner.

japanese: 管理人体調不良、モチの低下等により継続は不可能と判断しました。
english: Due to ill-health of the web-manager, loss of motivation and other circumstances I have decided that it is not possible to continue.

japanese: 監督はチームをトーナメント優勝に今一歩という所までもっていったのに悔しいことだった。
english: It was annoying, as the manager took his team to a near-miss in the tournament.

japanese: 漢字を書くときは点やはらいに気をつけて、なるべく早くていねいに書きましょう。
english: When drawing kanji be careful of dots and sweeps, write as carefully and quickly as possible.

japanese: 乾燥した空気のせいで痛んだノドや鼻の粘膜は、風邪のウイルスが入り込みやすくなってしまいます。暖房器具で寒さ対策、加湿器で乾燥対策をしっかり行なうことが肝要です。
english: Throat and nose membranes hurt by dry air allow cold viruses to enter more easily. It is important to carry out sensible counter plans against the cold with heaters and against the dryness with humidifiers.

japanese: 乾いてぼそぼそになったパンをかみながらの山の旅で、大蛇にあった。
english: While on a mountain trip, I was chewing on some hard, stale bread when I happened upon a huge snake.

japanese: 鴨にされる人というのはやはり鴨のオーラを発散しているということでしょう。
english: I suppose that means that, after all, people taken for a sucker give off a 'sucker aura'.

japanese: 株価上昇を契機に新工場建設の話が持ち上がった。
english: They took advantage of the stock price increase to raise the idea of building a new factory.

japanese: 革命政府は、民衆から兵をつのって防戦するとともに、共和政治を確立して、捕らえていたルイ１６世を処刑しました。
english: The revolutionary government, while raising troops from the masses and fighting a defensive battle, established a republic and executed Louis XVI.

japanese: 各国の政治家がホワイトハウス詣でをした。
english: Politicians from many countries made pilgrimages to the White House.

japanese: 咳止めシロップ。本番前に一口飲まないと落ち着かない！
english: Cough syrup. If I don't drink a mouthful before going on stage I can't settle down!

japanese: 外米はぼそぼそしていて、日本人の口には合わない。
english: Foreign rice is hard and tasteless, and doesn't appeal to the Japanese palate.

japanese: 外国人が日本に上陸する時は、到着した空港等で上陸許可の申請を行わなければなりません。
english: When foreign citizens land in Japan, they must apply for landing permission at the air or seaports where they arrive.

japanese: 外国為替レートってどのように表すの？外国為替市場では、米ドルを中心に表示されます。
english: How should foreign exchange rates be shown? In the foreign exchange market they are displayed centered on the American dollar.

japanese: 階層問題に対する、消費社会論の著である。
english: It is a literary work confronting the class problem of a consumer society.

japanese: 開発者は集合体として以下の権限を持つ。３：１の賛成多数をもって、この憲章を修正できる。
english: Together, the developers may amend this constitution, provided a 3:1 majority is in agreement.

japanese: 改めて反芻してると、何だか恥ずかしいぞ。
english: Now that I think over it, it's somewhat embarrassing.

japanese: 壊れたラジオを修理していて、回路の動作原理を理解できていないことに改めて気がつきます。
english: Repairing a broken radio I realise over again that I don't have an understanding of the operating principles of circuitry.

japanese: 回収対象のソニー製充電池は累計で７６５万９０００個となった。
english: The amount of Sony rechargeable batteries supposed to be collected totalled 7,659,000 units.

japanese: 会場に着くと早速担当者に「この絵は将来必ず値が上がる」などとしつこく言われ、契約書にサインしてしまった。
english: When I reached the hall right away the person in charge unrelentingly said things like "This painting is certain to increase in value in the future," and I went and signed the contract.

japanese: 会社をクビになったけど、貯金がすこしあるので、差し詰め生活には困らない。
english: I got the sack but I've a little saved up, so for the time being I won't be troubled by living expenses.

japanese: 会社に戻らず直帰することを上司に電話で伝えた。
english: I told my boss over the phone that I would be going straight home without returning to the company.

japanese: 会社が日中合弁で経営しています。
english: The company is operating under joint Sino-Japanese management.

japanese: 介護保険による介護サービスを利用するには、「介護が必要である」と認定される必要があります（要介護認定）。
english: In order to make use of the nursing services covered by long-term care insurance, an authorization form indicating their necessity must be filled out.

japanese: 我々は時代に一歩先んじた見識を持たねばならない。
english: We must be a step ahead of the times in our outlook.

japanese: 私はぬかるんだ斜面をずるずると滑り下りた。
english: I slithered down the muddy slope.

japanese: 過去問がもしあるならば一応目を通すほうがいいと思います。
english: If there are past exam questions then I think it would be best to give them a quick look over.

japanese: 花乃、嘘泣きはたまーにやるから効果あるんだぞ。
english: Kano, pretending to cry has impact from being used sparingly!

japanese: 花火の弾ける音が止むと、急に辺りが静かになる。後に残った火薬の匂いが、なんだか俺をセンチメンタルな気分にさせた。
english: As the popping sound of the fireworks stopped, it suddenly became quiet around me. The smell of gunpowder somehow put me in a sentimental mood.

japanese: 火力とお鍋と貝の種類によるわ。
english: It depends on the strength of the flame, the pan used and the type of ingredients.

japanese: 暇なら分家の仕事を手伝って来い。
english: If you've got the time help out with our relative's work.

japanese: 科学者の通弊は、あらゆる問題に技術的解決策があると誤認すること。
english: A fault common to scientists is mistakenly believing that every problem has a technical solution.

japanese: 家賃の支払いが5日を過ぎると、延滞料金が加算されます。
english: If your rent comes in past the fifth, a late charge will be added.

japanese: 家族生活に見られるもう一つの変化は、両親の子供に対する接し方である。
english: Another change in family life is the attitude of parents toward children.

japanese: 家では赤味がかった髪とそばかすのせいで、母が侮蔑を込めて「にんじん」と名付け、皆にもそう呼ばせています。
english: At home, because of his reddish hair and freckles, his mother scornfully named him "carrot" and had everybody else call him that.

japanese: 佳子ががりがり勉強している。
english: Keiko is studying furiously.

japanese: 何度も「やめましょうよ」と言ったのに、何杯もワインを飲み干し－－ご覧の通り、酔っ払ってハイになってしまったのである。
english: I kept saying "Let's stop" but she drained cup after cup of wine — and now, as you can see, she's completely drunk.

japanese: 何故か鷹派と目される人たちが、ことごとく苦手。
english: For some reason, I don't cope well with those recognized as hardliners.

japanese: 何はともあれ、大事にいたらなかったのは、不幸中の幸いであった。
english: At any rate, that it had ended without serious incident was a small mercy.

japanese: 何でそんな安っぽいペテンにひっかかるんだ。
english: Why do people get fooled by such cheap schemes?

japanese: 何だ、貴様は。庇い立てする気か。
english: What now, you wretch? You thinking of protecting her?

japanese: 何しろ朝から夕方まで、校舎の中で軟禁状態だからな。釈放されれば元気にもなるってもんだ。
english: Anyhow, having been held in school from morning to evening ... anybody'd be happy on getting released.

japanese: 何か飄々とはぐらかされてる気がするわ。
english: I get the feeling I'm being given the runaround.

japanese: 何がなんだか分からない。頭がパニックに陥って整理がつかない。
english: I didn't know what was what. The inside of my head had gone to panic mode and I couldn't get things straight.

japanese: 何があっても海に行く！タオルに、海パン。虫除けスプレー！
english: No matter what I'm going to the beach! Towel and trunks. Insect repellant!

japanese: 何か、全部、こじつけって感じがするんだけど・・・。
english: Somehow, all those reasons sound rather far fetched.

japanese: 下手の横好きで撮影している写真を日記とともに紹介しています。
english: I'm introducing some pictures I took, dabbling in photography, along with my diary.

japanese: 下手に独自の方向性を出すと、攻撃されてしまうから、安全パイの報道しかしない。
english: They'll be attacked if they carelessly express an original viewpoint, so they only report on the safe options.

japanese: 下手に手を動かすと気付かれてしまうという強迫観念が俺を襲う。
english: I was assailed by the stupid, but unshakeable, idea that if I was imprudent enough to move my hand I'd be noticed.

japanese: 下校の途中で犬をつれた女の子と遊んだ。
english: Halfway back from school I played with a girl who was walking her dog.

japanese: 音楽の好みは人によって好きずきです。
english: Music preferences vary from person to person.

japanese: 音を大きくして。
english: Turn the volume up.

japanese: 音が大きい方が、がしがし仕事してるように見えるという人と、うるさいだけって言う人いますよね。
english: Of those on the loud side, some people say they look like they're briskly working, while others say that they're just noisy.

japanese: 恩人に礼節を欠いてはなりませんよ。
english: You must not lack decorum dealing with your benefactors.

japanese: 俺は世間で言うアホです。
english: I'm what the world calls an idiot.

japanese: 俺は小学校の時見たんだ、人魚。でもそんなメルヘンチックな話じゃなくて。
english: I saw one, a mermaid, when I was a primary schooler. But it wasn't that sort of fairy-tale atmosphere of a story.

japanese: 俺は慌てて探し物に本腰を入れ始めた。
english: I hurriedly started searching in earnest.

japanese: 俺は家族全員に見送られながら、旅支度を整えたザックを担ぐ。
english: Being seen off by my whole family I shouldered a rucksack, stocked with my trip supplies.

japanese: 俺はそんなこの町が好きだ。石段とかが多いのはネックだが・・・。
english: I like this town as it is. Although, there being so many stone stairs is a bit of a pain...

japanese: 俺たちはお互いに見てて、持ちつ持たれつですよ。
english: We'll watch each other and help each other out.

japanese: 俺この件に関してノータッチなんで。
english: I'm not getting involved in this.

japanese: 俺が気づいたとき、俺は車の中にいた。
english: When I woke up, I was in the car.

japanese: 王女があくどい化粧をしていた。
english: The princess was wearing too much makeup.

japanese: 横着しないで、教わった漢字を使いなさい。
english: Don't be lazy, use the kanji you've been taught.

japanese: 押し付けられると反発しちゃうのが人間っていうものなんじゃないか。
english: Isn't it reacting against that forced on us that is "human"?

japanese: 奥さんのがみがみ小言にフレッドさんは大弱りの体であった。
english: Fred was very troubled by his wife's nagging.

japanese: 遠距離恋愛をしたことはありますか。
english: Have you ever been in a long distance relationship?

japanese: 遠くの兄弟より、良き隣人。
english: A good neighbour is better than a brother far off.

japanese: 延泊をお願いできますか？
english: Can I extend my stay?

japanese: 英語には８つの主な品詞があります：　名詞、動詞、形容詞、副詞、代名詞、前置詞、接続詞そして感嘆詞。
english: In English there are eight main parts of speech: noun, verb, adjective, adverb, pronoun, preposition, conjunction and finally interjection.

japanese: 運命の赤い糸でつながってるんだよ。
english: We're joined by the red string of fate!

japanese: 運んできてくれたランチは噂に違わず旨かった。
english: The lunch she brought to me was as delicious as rumoured.

japanese: 瓜のつるに茄子はならぬ。
english: You don't get eggplants from a gourd vine.

japanese: 運よく薬が効くとき１時過ぎに寝れるけど、薬を飲まないと４時ぐらいまで眠れない。
english: If I'm lucky enough for the medicine to work I can get to sleep after 1am but if I don't take it then I can't sleep until about 4am.

japanese: 嘘ではないにしろ、ホラに近い。
english: If not a lie, close to a boast.

japanese: 雨天なら、山登りは、取りやめます。
english: If it's rainy the mountain climbing will be called off.

japanese: 雨がひどく降ったのでグラウンドはぐしゃぐしゃだ。
english: It rained heavily, so the playground is muddy.

japanese: 右上にある「バッテン」のボタンが、ウィンドウを消すボタンだよ。
english: The "X" button in the top right shuts the window.

japanese: 右手には、いかにも、「魔法少女アイテムです」と言わんばかりの怪しげなロッドが握られていた。
english: In her right hand was gripped a suspicious looking rod that practically radiated "I'm a magical girl item".

japanese: 飲む分だけ豆をローストして、ミルで挽くんです。
english: We roast just enough beans for the amount we're going to drink, and grind them in the coffee mill.

japanese: 印刷物には、特別郵袋印刷物というのがあります。
english: Included in the printed matter category is what is called 'special mailbag printed matter'.

japanese: 一郎はどことなく傷ついたように言ったが、それが嘘っぱちであることはこいつとの長年の付き合いが教えてくれた。
english: Ichiro sounded somehow upset but my long years of hanging out with him told me that it was out and out fake.

japanese: 一部の住民が様子見の態度を取る一方で他の者は大洪水に備えた。
english: Some residents took a wait-and-see attitude while others prepared for heavy flooding.

japanese: 私は一日中出掛けていた。
english: I was out all day.

japanese: 一族が苦労して積み上げてきたものを、お前は一瞬で反故にするつもりか。
english: Do you intend to throw away in one instant what our family has painstakingly built up?

japanese: 一生懸命指でまぶたを広げて目薬を差しました。
english: With great effort I held his eyelids open with my fingers and dropped in the eye medicine.

japanese: 一人はみんなの為に、みんなは一人の為に。それがチームプレイだ。
english: All for one, and one for all. That's team play.

japanese: 一子ちゃんは同じ穴のムジナか、同輩の親しみを込めた笑みを俺に向ける。
english: I guess Ichiko is a fellow rule-breaker, she's sending me a smile filled with affection for a comrade.

japanese: 一つのミスで荒らしと間違えられて、叩かれてしまう。
english: Just one slip and you'll be mistaken for a troll and flamed.

japanese: 一からやるんだから、大胆にイメチェンすればよかったのに。
english: As you're starting from scratch you might as well have gone for a major makeover...

japanese: 医者になれる日はまだほど遠い。
english: I'm still miles off becoming a doctor.

japanese: 違う違う。オリジナリティがあるっていうか。
english: No, no. I mean to say that it has originality.

japanese: 椅子とかテーブルとかの搬入はどうするの？
english: What will we do about getting tables, chairs and such?

japanese: 安倍内閣は、第９０代の内閣総理大臣に指名された安倍晋三が２００６年９月２６日に発足させた内閣である。
english: The Abe Cabinet is the Cabinet inaugurated on September 26, 2006 by Shinzo Abe, who was appointed as Japan's 90th Prime Minister.

japanese: 安倍内閣は、自由民主党、公明党を与党とする連立内閣である。
english: The Abe Cabinet is a coalition Cabinet where the Liberal Democratic Party and New Komei Party form the government.

japanese: んじゃ、ほんのり・・・実力を出しましょうかね。
english: Well then, let's show a little of our real strength shall we?

japanese: わたしは国の富が公平に分配される社会を夢見ている。
english: I dream of a society whose wealth is distributed fairly.

japanese: わたしのテクに抜かりはないわ。
english: My technique is without flaw.

japanese: わたしが前をよく見てなかったから、出会い頭にぶつかっちゃって。小川くんは悪くないわ。
english: Because I wasn't looking where I was going, I bumped into him when we passed. It wasn't his fault.

japanese: わずかなヒントを糸口にして、正しいこたえを見つけた。
english: He took a slight hint as the start and found the correct answer.

japanese: ロビンは口が肥えて贅沢になったのかしら。
english: Perhaps Robin's got a taste for the finer things in life and has become extravagant.

japanese: ロシア：人質事件の犠牲となった方々に哀悼の意を表す。
english: Russia expresses regret for those lost in the hostage incident.

japanese: ローマのホテルの予約を、３日ずらさなければならなくなった。
english: I had to put back the hotel reservations for Rome by three days.

japanese: レンジャーが道を拓く。
english: The Rangers lead the way.

japanese: レースのカーテンから透けて見えた世界は暗かった。
english: The world seen through the lace curtain was dark.

japanese: ルーは、バターと小麦粉を炒めながら作ります。
english: Roux is made while cooking flour and butter together.

japanese: りんごを少し買ってください。
english: Please buy a few apples.

japanese: リハの回数増えたから仕事キチキチだよ。
english: With the extra rehearsals, work is really tight.

japanese: リストのデータは、自動集計機能を使って簡単に集計することができます。
english: List data can easily be totalled using the automatic sum function.

japanese: ランナーはコーナーを回ってホームストレッチへ入った。
english: The runners rounded the corner into the homestretch.

japanese: ランチボックスからは、色んなオカズの匂いが、立ちのぼっている。
english: The smell of various foodstuffs drifted up from the lunch box.

japanese: よんどころない事情で、今年の夏は別荘で過ごせないんだ。
english: Due to unavoidable circumstances this summer I can't stay in my holiday cottage.

japanese: よりによって相手がノーマークのスーちゃんなんて。
english: That it be with the off-the-radar Sue of all people!

japanese: よく聞いたら、ネタじゃなくてマジボケだったみたいです。
english: When I asked afterwards it seems he hadn't said that as a joke.

japanese: ユーモラスな話から気持ちの悪い話まで、前巻同様にいろいろなタイプの話が楽しめます。
english: From humorous to creepy stories, like the last volume, you can enjoy various types of stories.

japanese: やり残すことがないように頑張るぞ。
english: I'll do my best to have nothing left to do!

japanese: やっぱり男手があると、作業の幅が広がるねぇ。
english: When there's a man around, the work that can be done sure increases.

japanese: やっとほしい本を手に入れた。
english: I finally got hold of that book I wanted.

japanese: ものにはたいてい表と裏がある。
english: With most things there's both what you see and what's behind it.

japanese: もちろん冗談と思って彼は「あっそ」と流していましたけどかなり嫌だったそうです。ってゆうか冗談でもそんなこと言うな！
english: Of course he thought it was a joke and let it slide with a "hm?" but he was seriously annoyed. I mean, just don't say things like that even as a joke!

japanese: もし音信不通になったら警察に連絡してね。
english: If I drop out of contact, let the police know, OK?

japanese: もしかしてツンツンしているのは、生理痛なだけとか？いや、まさかね。
english: Could it be that her prickly attitude is just because she has period pains? No, couldn't be.

japanese: モールの中に、比較的大きなシネコンがある。
english: There's a comparatively large cinema complex inside the mall.

japanese: もー、弥生のナビが判りにくいから、同じトコぐるぐる回ったじゃない。
english: Hmph, Yayoi's navigation was difficult to follow so we ended up going round and round the same places.

japanese: もう一度伺ってよろしいですか。
english: Could you repeat that?

japanese: もうっ、全然勉強が手につかないわよっ！！
english: Enough! I can't get any study done at all!

japanese: もう、そんな顔をするなら、またただの友達に格下げするわよ。
english: Oh, you! If you go around with a face like that, I'll have to demote you back down to 'friend' again.

japanese: メモには、水に浮かぶ練習をさせるように、と殴り書きされていた。
english: On the memo was scrawled, "have her practice floating in the water."

japanese: メニュー・バーの「返事」から、「フォローアップ記事の作成」を選ぶ。フォローする記事が引用される。
english: From the menu-bar's "Reply" select "create follow-up message". The message you reply to is quoted.

japanese: めったに乗らないヨットなんてただの金食い虫だ。
english: It's just throwing money away to have a yacht you rarely use.

japanese: メーカーの謳い文句を迂闊に信じてはいけない。
english: You mustn't carelessly believe the maker's motto.

japanese: むろん、舟は何百艘も水面を動きまわっているが、どれでもいいというわけにはいかない。
english: Of course there were several hundred boats moving around on the water but not just any old one would do.

japanese: むやみに自殺を否定しようとは思いませんが、親が子どもを道連れにするのはぜったいにやめてほしい、と思います。
english: I don't intend to flatly reject suicide, but I really wish parents would not make their children join in with them.

japanese: みんな、俺も全力でフォローする。このイベントかならず成功させるぞ。
english: Guys, I'll do my utmost to back you up. We'll make this event a success no matter what!

japanese: みなプロジェクトを抱えているので、差し詰め、君しか適任者はいない。
english: Everybody has their own projects on, so after all you are the only suitable candidate.

japanese: みつなは綺麗好きだから、よく自ら進んで掃除をしています。
english: Mitsuna is very tidy so she often cleans up without being asked.

japanese: マルチするなアホ。
english: Don't multi-post, idiot.

japanese: まだ肉眼じゃ無理だよ。双眼鏡だと、ちょびっとだけ見えるかも・・・。
english: It's still impossible with the naked eye. With binoculars you might be able to glimpse it....

japanese: また辞去する際に決して忘れないようにすること。
english: It is very important to be careful not to forget them when you leave.

japanese: まだまだマイナーだが、遠からず近隣に出荷されるだろう。
english: It's still minor league but in the not so distant future they'll be coming to a place near you.

japanese: まだどちらと決したわけではありませんので、引き続き成り行きを見守りたいと思います。
english: I haven't decided either way. I want to keep an eye on how things go.

japanese: また、親しい間柄であることから、暴力の被害を受けやすく、その被害を訴えにくいという実態がある。
english: Also as they are in an intimate relationship they are in a situation where it is easy for them to suffer from violence and difficult for them to bring complaints about that to court.

japanese: まだ、完了と言うところまで行っていないが、そこそこ成果が出始めてきた。
english: It's not yet what you'd call finished but we're starting to get pretty good results.

japanese: まず最初の議題は今朝の同衾騒動の件について。
english: Starting off, first on the agenda is about this morning's two-in-a-bed ruckus.

japanese: まず、私の活動範囲は、おもに養老川下流域です。
english: First off, my area of work is mainly in the lower reaches of the Yourou River.

japanese: まず、市長あてに、請願書を提出して、署名運動をしています。
english: First, we will present a petition to the mayor and collect signatures.

japanese: まさか惚れたんですか。認めん、認めんぞ。あの男を義弟になるなんて、僕は絶対いやです！
english: You haven't fallen in love, have you!? I won't have it! Having that man become my brother-in-law; I absolutely hate that!

japanese: まさか花子さんをストーキングするなんて・・・！最近、おとなしいから油断したわ！
english: That you should be stalking Hanako! You'd been quiet recently so I'd let my guard down.

japanese: まさかリアルに借金の催促だったの？
english: No way, is this really a debt collection call?

japanese: まさかそのような窮地に立たされているとは露知らず。
english: Good grief! I had no idea you had been placed in such a tight spot.

japanese: まさかオレがごねずにすっきり起きると思っていなかったに違いない。
english: Certainly she wouldn't have dreamt that I would get up promptly without grumbling.

japanese: まあまあ、そう怒らないでくださいな。
english: Now, please don't get so angry.

japanese: まあまあなんて細い腰なの！お顔も小さくて、本当にお人形さんみたい！
english: My what a narrow waist! Her face is small, she really looks just like a doll!

japanese: まぁ、日本も鎖国していたわけだしなあ。
english: Well, after all Japan also cut itself off from the world.

japanese: まあ、広義的には間違っていませんね。
english: Well, broadly speaking that's right.

japanese: まあ、過ちを改めるに遅すぎるということはない。
english: Well, there's no such thing as being too late to correct one's faults.

japanese: まあ、それは渡っていけば分かることだ。あまり最初からネタバレしていると、面白みが無いからな。
english: Well, you'll find out that after you cross. If I give too much away right from the start it won't be so interesting.

japanese: ホントにどうしたんですか？いつもの覇気がないですよ。
english: Really - what's up? Where's your go-for-it attitude?

japanese: ホントしつこいなぁ、しのぶさん。なんか根負けしそう。
english: Shinobu is really persistent. It seems that I am beaten.

japanese: ホワイトバランスをオートにした場合と白いコピー用紙でプリセットした場合の比較です。
english: It's a comparison of setting the white balance to "auto" versus presetting it with white copy paper.

japanese: ホワイトニングなどの治療を行います。ヤニ取りなどのクリーニングも行っています。
english: We carry out treatments like whitening. We also do tobacco stain removal and other cleaning procedures.

japanese: ほらマンゴーがたくさんなっているよ。
english: Look at all the mangoes growing on that tree.

japanese: ほら、付き合ったばっかりの頃ってベタベタしたいじゃない？
english: You see, when you have just started a relationship, you want to be close to each other, don't you?

japanese: ほら、今日は海の幸だったから明日は山の幸とかさ、取りに行こうよっ。
english: Look, today was 'sea harvest' so let's go forage for edible plants tomorrow!

japanese: ほら、健一、そこの雨樋伝っておいでよ。引っ張ってあげるから。
english: Hey, Ken'ichi, come along that drain pipe. I'll pull you up.

japanese: ポニーテールが翻って思わず見とれる仕草だ。
english: The way she flips her ponytail will charm you before you realise it.

japanese: ポットとティーセットが乗った、小さなカートを押して、セイカちゃんが部屋に入ってきた。
english: Seika came into the room pushing a small cart with a pot and a tea set resting on it.

japanese: ほっそい道にほとんどスピードを落とさず、走りこんだ。「近道なんですよ」「ってここ、あぜ道～～～っ！」
english: We sped into the narrow track, hardly dropping any speed. "It's a short cut!" "Oi! It's a footpath!!"

japanese: ほそぼそとしたアクセスや、たまにくるメールなどに励まされ、ズルズルここまできてしまいました。
english: Encouraged by the continuing trickle of hits and the rarely arriving email I've somehow kept going till now.

japanese: ボケッとしないで、さっさとメモ書きなさいよっ。
english: Don't just stand there like a lump, start taking notes!

japanese: ぼくはやばい橋は渡りたくない。
english: I don't want to do anything risky.

japanese: ぼく、どうしたの？
english: What's up, kiddo?

japanese: ポールの髪には潤いがない。
english: Paul has dry hair.

japanese: ポールは手で髪を梳きました。
english: Paul ran his hand through his hair.

japanese: ポールはいつも女性の体を弄っている。
english: Paul is always groping women.

japanese: ボーイング社は海上自衛隊用の飛行艇を開発しました。
english: Boeing developed a flying boat for the Maritime Self-Defense Force.

japanese: ほうれん草をのこさずにたべなさい。
english: Eat up all your spinach!

japanese: ボイラは湯あかがびっしりついた。
english: The boiler was heavily scaled.

japanese: ペンを動かす距離が短かったり、速度が遅かったりすると、うまくジェスチャーが認識されず思った通りの操作ができない。
english: If the distance you move the pen is too small, the speed too slow, it can't recognize the gestures well and you can't operate it in the way you thought.

japanese: ヘレンの言葉で私は急に力づいた。
english: Helen's words suddenly filled me with new energy.

japanese: ベニヤ板で十分だとのこと、教えられたとおりベニヤ板で作ることにします。
english: Having been informed that plywood is sufficient, I will make it with plywood, as instructed.

japanese: ベタベタするんじゃねえよっ！鬱陶しい！
english: Get off me you little pest!

japanese: ベェーだっ！乙女のことを嗤った罰よ！
english: Pfft! That's what you get for laughing at a girl!

japanese: ペールエールはアルコール含有量の少ないビールだ。
english: Pale ale is a low-alcohol beer.

japanese: ブ男の兄で悪かったな。
english: Well, excuse me for being an ugly-ass brother.

japanese: フロントローラーのスラスト角は２度、多分レース時にはもう少し角度を強める予定です。
english: The front-roller thrust angle is 2 degrees, probably there were plans to strengthen that angle a little when racing.

japanese: フロッピーなフロッピーはもう売り切れ。
english: Floppy floppies are already sold out.

japanese: プレゼントにするきれいな貝がらをひろいにいったよ！
english: I went looking for pretty shells as a present!

japanese: ブレーキがキーキーいうバイクなんて欲しがる人いるわけ？
english: Who wants to buy a motorcycle with squeaky brakes?

japanese: ブレーカー上げてくればいいの。早く！
english: You just need to reset the breaker. Hurry up!

japanese: フランス語の授業で教授の言ったことについてノートを取りなさい。
english: Write down what the teacher dictates in the French class.

japanese: フランクス陸軍大将がナイト爵位の名誉称号を授かりました。
english: General Franks received an honorary knighthood.

japanese: フラフラと歩き回る様は、あまりにデンジャラスだ。
english: The way she dizzily moves around is far too dangerous.

japanese: ふふ・・・いわくがあるのさ、あそこには。
english: He-heh... there's a tale behind that, for that place.

japanese: ふと通りに目をやると、行き交う人の中に、１人立ち止まり俺を見下ろす者がいた。
english: As I glanced at the street there was somebody looking down at me in the middle of those walking past each other.

japanese: プチッ、と糸を犬歯で噛み切った。
english: I snapped the thread on my canine.

japanese: フェンスの向こう側に片足を振り出した。
english: I swung my leg over the fence.

japanese: フェミニストカウンセリングを一言で説明するなら、女性の視点にたったカウンセリングということになるでしょうか。
english: If you sum up feminist counselling in a few words, I suppose it would be counselling done from a woman's standpoint.

japanese: フェアにやろうとは申しませんけど、無思慮な行動はおやめ頂きたいですわ。
english: I will not say play fair but I would wish that you refrain from indiscreet acts.

japanese: こっちにきてから、ずっと近所でビバークしてたの？大変だったね。
english: You've been camping out ever since you came over here? Must have been terrible.

japanese: こだわりはお客に伝わってこそ意味をなす。
english: Care over the particulars only has meaning once it gets across to customers.

japanese: ここにゴミ捨てるべからず。
english: No dumping rubbish here!

japanese: ここで中断したら元の木阿弥だぞっ。
english: If we stop here, we'll be right back where we started!

japanese: ここで意味のない押し問答を続けては・・・昨日の繰り返しですわね。
english: If you continue with the pointless arguments here...it'll end up as a repeat of yesterday.

japanese: ここでは１０分を切った選手のみを集めたのですが、見ての通り平山の記録は５人の中で最も遅い記録です。
english: Here we have assembled only athletes who have broken 10 minutes but, as you can see, Hirayama's record is the slowest of the five people.

japanese: ここ、結構パスタがいけるのよ。あとピザも。
english: The pasta here's pretty good. And the pizza too.

japanese: こーゆーのは、買うのが楽しいのよ。使うか使わないかなんてのは、二の次なんだって。
english: This sort of thing, it's buying stuff that's fun. Whether you use it or not is secondary.

japanese: コーポレートガバナンスや説明責任を強化している。
english: Corporate governance and accountability are being strengthened.

japanese: コーヒー通の人達に結構評判がいいそうです。
english: I hear that it has quite the reputation with coffee connoisseurs.

japanese: コートを探してます。背が低いので、丈は短めで、なるべくすっきりしたデザインのものを。
english: I'm looking for a coat. I'm short so the length should be on the short side, and as refined a design as possible.

japanese: こうして武田の悲鳴で通りすがりの船に気付いてもらえ、事なきをえました。
english: In this way a passing boat noticed them, thanks to Takeda's scream, and they survived without incident.

japanese: こいつがそんな玉じゃないことなんてとうの昔に解っていたからさ。
english: That's because, you see, I've known he isn't that sort of person from a long time back.

japanese: こいつ、さっきまで俺の相棒だったのに、もう寝返りやがった。
english: This rat, up until just now he was my partner and now he's gone and turned on me.

japanese: けど、一晩加湿器つけっぱなしで朝になると窓が結露してドボドボ・・・。
english: But because the humidifier is on all night, in the morning the condensation pours off the windows.

japanese: けったくそ悪いから、やりたくないことはやらない。
english: 'Cuz it's a giant pain in the arse, if I don't wanna do something I just won't do it.

japanese: けい子と一朗が納得ずくで別れた。
english: Keiko and Ichiro parted with mutual consent.

japanese: ゲイツ会長、広告収入をユーザーに還元する意向表明。
english: Bill Gates announces intent to return advertising revenue to the users.

japanese: ケイちゃんはとても運がいいのよ。お産の時から、そうだったわ。
english: Kei's very lucky! He has been since his birth.

japanese: クリック：マウスの「左側」のボタンを素早く「一回」プチッと押す事です。
english: Click: Quickly pushing the mouse's left hand side button once.

japanese: グリーンピースは鉄分が豊富で爪の色がよくなる成分が含まれている。
english: Green peas are high in iron and contain nutrients that improve the colour of fingernails.

japanese: ぐはっ！？俺の貴重な頭髪を、むしるな！
english: O-oi!? Don't rip off my precious hair!

japanese: クラッチペダルを数回踏むと、なんとかクラッチが切れたので、騙し騙し運転しました。
english: Repeatedly slamming the clutch pedal, I somehow managed to get the clutch disengaged so I could just about drive for the time being.

japanese: くそっ、スルーしやがった。
english: Dammit, she completely ignored me.

japanese: くしくも、レジでの合計額は７７７円であった。
english: Strangely, the cash register's total was 777 yen.

japanese: ぎょうざの具のあまりは？餃子を家で作りましたが、皮が少なかったせいか、具が少し余ってしまいました。
english: Gyoza stuffing? I made some gyoza at home but, possibly because I didn't have enough dough, I had some of the filling left over.

japanese: きのう交差点でお釜を掘られちゃったよ。
english: Someone ploughed into me from behind at an intersection yesterday.

japanese: きつつきは、長く尖ったくちばしで、木の幹をつついて、中にいる虫を食べます。
english: Woodpeckers peck tree trunks with their long pointed beaks and eat insects found there.

japanese: カレンの裾が捲れている。
english: Karen's skirt is riding up.

japanese: 彼は一時的に精神が錯乱状態になった。
english: He became temporarily deranged.

japanese: 彼はお人よしのカモから大金を巻き上げました。
english: He made heaps of money by ripping off naive suckers.

japanese: カレーはまあまあでした。
english: The curry was nothing special.

japanese: カラー・キー・プログラム・システムでは全ての色が「クールパレット」と「ウォームパレット」の２つに分けられる。
english: With the colour key program system, all colours are divided into two palettes, the "cool palette" and the "warm palette".

japanese: かなりあくどい事をしてきたそうだな。
english: I hear you've done some pretty extreme stuff.

japanese: カタツムリがすっと角を出した。
english: The snail shot out its horns.

japanese: カズちゃん、さっき完膚無きまでに振っちゃおうとしたでしょ？
english: You were about to dump her flat out, weren't you?

japanese: かくかくしかじかで、と事情を説明したのだが、あんまり興味なさそうな相槌しか返ってこなかった。
english: I explained the situation, as this, that and such and such, but they just nodded along without showing much interest.

japanese: ガイドブックによれば、ここがここいらで一番美味しい店なんだって。
english: According to the guidebook, this is the best restaurant around here.

japanese: カール・マルクス曰く「あらゆる社会の歴史は階級闘争の歴史である」だそうです。
english: Karl Marx says, "The history of all hitherto existing societies is the history of class struggles."

japanese: カーペットには埃を吸収するダストポケット効果があり、埃の飛散を防ぐ特長があるのだが、それが仇になった結果といえる。
english: Carpets have the effect of a dust pocket, with merit of sucking up dust and stopping it flying around, but you can say that effect backfires.

japanese: お墓には供花が供えられていた。
english: An offering of flowers had been placed at the grave.

japanese: お米屋さんは、言わずと知れた斜陽産業。
english: Needless to say, dealing in rice is a declining industry.

japanese: お風呂をお召しください。
english: Please take a bath.

japanese: お庭の方にも縁台を並べれば、かなり座席数を確保できそうだなーと思いました。
english: I thought that if we lined up benches in the garden as well, we could achieve quite a seating capacity.

japanese: お茶は仕事をスムーズに運ばせるための潤滑油のようなもの。
english: Tea is like the lubricating oil of work to allow it to proceed smoothly.

japanese: お祖母さんの昔話は耳にたこができるほど聞かされた。
english: I've heard my grandma's stories so often that I'm heartily sick of them.

japanese: お祖母さんが座布団の上にちんまりとすわっていました。
english: The old woman was snugly sitting on a cushion.

japanese: お祖父さんがかなり老衰している。
english: Grandfather is quite senile.

japanese: お祖父さまはお風邪を召していらっしゃいます。
english: Grandfather has caught a cold.

japanese: お前が近くにいるのをいいことにベタベタしやがって！！
english: What the fuck are you up to taking advantage of his proximity to cling to him like a wet T-shirt?!

japanese: お世辞に乗せられると、身の破滅を招く。
english: When the flatterer pipes, then the devil dances.

japanese: お子さんが車をおりたらすぐに車を出してください。
english: Please drive off as soon as your child has left the car.

japanese: お兄ちゃん、すごい熱だよ！？荷物はいいから、そこの木陰で休んでて！
english: Big brother, you've got a bad fever?! Never mind the bags, rest in the shade of those trees!

japanese: お兄ちゃん、このお魚本当に美味しいの？黒鯛が極道に落ちて、全国指名手配されたみたいなお魚だよ？
english: Hey, is this fish tasty for real? It looks like a black porgy who'd fallen in with mobsters and been put on the country's most wanted list!?

japanese: お金がないので、プチッと旅行。
english: As I don't have the money, it'll just be a short trip.

japanese: お客さまを迎える前には、トイレの鍵がかかるかどうかもしっかりチェックして。
english: Before meeting your guests, be sure to carefully check that the toilet door locks.

japanese: おやおや。いかな体育の授業といえど・・・真剣勝負の意気込みで臨まなければ、いざ実戦と言う時に役に立ちませんよ。
english: Well, even if it is just P.E. class, if you don't take it seriously, it won't do you any good in a real match.

japanese: おまじないって言うのはね、女の子が好きな人と結ばれるように願をかけたりすることだよ。
english: What you call a 'charm', you know, is what girls wish upon that they may get together with the person they love and such like.

japanese: オマエ、そりゃいくらなんでもボッタクリ過ぎだろ！６：４がいいとこだろうが。もちろん、６は俺な！
english: Oi you, that's too much of a rip off by anyone's count! 6:4 is more than enough. Of course I'm the '6'.

japanese: オプションとして４速自動変速機も選べる。
english: 4-speed automatic transmission is available as an option.

japanese: おはよう。春樹兄さん。寝癖ついてるよ。
english: Morning, Haruki. You've got bed hair.

japanese: おはよう。ご飯をよそっても良いかしら？
english: Morning. Shall I dish up?

japanese: おっと！火種が残りすくないぞ！薪割りしてくれ！
english: Whoops! There aren't many live coals left! Go make some kindling would you?

japanese: オチの意味がわからなかったらすいません・・・。
english: If you don't get the punch line, I'm sorry.

japanese: おかげでほぼ完徹だ。
english: Thanks to which I was up nearly all night.

japanese: オーボエ奏者なんかは自分にあうリードを探すより作った方が速いと、自分で作ってしまう人もいる。
english: Heck, with oboe players there are those who, rather than search for a reed that suits them, find it faster to make their own.

japanese: オーブントースターのタイマーが鳴る。食パンがコンガリ焼けた、香ばしい匂い。
english: The toaster-oven's timer rings. The fragrant smell of well toasted bread.

japanese: オープンソースは技術革新をドライブするエンジンである。
english: Open source is the engine that drives technological innovation.

japanese: おい、おっさん！何やってんだよ！
english: Hey, pops! What are you doing!

japanese: おいおい、もう締め切りまで時間無いぞ？ぼやっとしないでくれたまえ。
english: Hey, there's no time left till the deadline, you know? Stop hanging around in a daze!

japanese: おい、いい加減パンツネタはやめとけよな、読者が退く、ドンビキ。
english: Hey, it's about time you quit it with the panty jokes. You'll put off the readers, you creeper!

japanese: お、タエ、このチーズいけるよ。
english: Oh, Tae, this cheese is a winner!

japanese: エンジンを空回りさせちゃいかん。長持ちさせたいからね。
english: Don't race the car. We want to make it go as far as possible.

japanese: えへへへ、私は運痴だから、ちょっと走ると、すぐに脇腹が痛くなっちゃうの。
english: He-heh-heh, I'm terrible at sports so if I run a while my sides hurt right away.

japanese: えっへんと大いばりでアリスは胸を張った。
english: "A-hem!" Alice boasted, puffing up with pride.

japanese: エステサロンで優雅な至福のひとときを過ごしてみませんか？
english: How about spending an elegant and blissful time at a beauty salon?

japanese: えーと、パン粉は有ったかな？
english: Hmm, did we have some breadcrumbs?

japanese: ええ、このところ野宿ばかりだったものだから、久しぶりにゆっくり出来ました。ありがとう。
english: Yes, thanks. Recently I've been roughing it so I was able to get a proper sleep for the first time in a while.

japanese: エイズウイルスの拡散は恐るべき速さで進んでいる。
english: The speed of the spread of AIDS is horrifyingly fast.

japanese: エアコンはオプションの付属品です。
english: An air conditioner is available as an optional extra.

japanese: うん、誤診だったみたい。
english: Yes, it seems it was a misdiagnosis.

japanese: うわっ？これ、勉強に運動神経、全てのパラメータがMAXじゃないか！おまけにお金もカンストするまで貯まってる・・・すげえ。
english: Wha? Study, reflexes, all the parameters are MAX! You've even saved money up to the limit ... Amazing.

japanese: うむ。これだけのことをされて、ブチキレないほうがおかしい。
english: So. Having had all that done to him it would be stranger if he wasn't enraged.

japanese: うまくいったら連ドラを紹介してあげる。
english: If it goes well, I'll put you forward for a drama serial.

japanese: うっとうしい梅雨期に、すっきりしない話で恐縮ですが、少しの間お付き合いください。
english: I'm ashamed to tell such a muddled story in this dreary, rainy season, but please bear with me for a while.

japanese: ウチも分煙しなきゃいけないよねぇ。
english: We'll also have to create a separate smoking section, won't we?

japanese: うちが援助してる酒造さんがね、新しい甘酒を造ったから試飲してみてくださいって持ってきてくれたんだけど。
english: A brewery we finance has made a new sweet sake and brought some to us asking us to try it.

japanese: ウェブ・サーバーがクッキーを利用している場合はどうなるのでしょうか。
english: I wonder how it is when the web server uses cookies?

japanese: ううん、由美ちゃんが魔法瓶に入れて、部室に持って来てくれたの。
english: No, Yumi put it in a thermos flask and brought it into the club room.

japanese: インターネットの接続が遮断された。
english: My internet connection was cut off.

japanese: インサイダー取引に当たる疑いが濃厚になってきた。
english: Suspicion that this amounts to insider trading has strengthened.

japanese: インコやオウムと仲良く楽しく健やかに暮らすために、飼鳥の行動学やペットロスについて考える。
english: In order to live happily and healthily with parakeets or parrots, you should understand the science of animal behavior for domesticated birds, and consider the emotional effect of eventually losing them.

japanese: インキ補充瓶のキャップを外し、スポイトでインキを吸い上げ、マーカーの吸収体へ適量、滴下してください。
english: Remove the cap from the ink refill bottle, fill the dropper with ink, and drip an appropriate amount onto the marker's core.

japanese: いらぬ告げ口をして彼らの結婚生活に波風を立てることはない。
english: There's no need to tell on him and mess up their marriage.

japanese: いよいよ薄暮、もうすぐ宵闇。
english: It's getting more and more shadowy, soon it will be twilight.

japanese: イヤなところといえば、仕事とプライベートがかなりごっちゃになっちゃうってところだな。
english: The downside, well, it's how thoroughly work gets mixed up with my private life.

japanese: いやいや、結構結構。下の名前で呼び合うのは親近感がわいてよろしいことだ。
english: Not at all, that's perfectly fine. Calling each other by one's given name is a good thing; it produces a feeling of fellowship.

japanese: いやぁ！あきちゃんのチャイナ、可愛かった。あぶなく、理性のタガが外れるとこだった。
english: Oh man! Aki in a china dress was so cute. I almost lost it then.

japanese: いつ返してもらってもいいですよ。その本は布教用に買った本ですから。
english: You can give it back whenever you want to as I bought that book for missionary work.

japanese: いつも妙ちくりんなことばっかり書いてるもんだから、きっとコメントしにくいんだわ！
english: I'm always writing weird and hoopy stuff so I'm sure it's difficult to comment on.

japanese: いつもは脚立を使ってるんですけど、・・・揺れて怖くて・・・だから押さえていて欲しいんです。
english: I always use the steps, but...it's scary how they wobble...so I'd like you to hold them steady.

japanese: いつもあかだらけで、食事も満足に与えられていない様子でした。
english: He was always filthy and looked like he wasn't given enough food.

japanese: いったん着地した怪物は、瞬間ふたたび跳躍して私の頭上にいた。
english: Having once landed the monster immediately jumped again and was over my head.

japanese: いっそのこと初めから家にいたほうがよかった。
english: With all that we might have been better off just to have stayed home.

japanese: いくら壁が高いといっても、私も最初はおっかなびっくりでしたよ。
english: You're right when you say how high the wall is; I was nervous at first, too.

japanese: いくら器だけを日本一にしても、中身が三流やったらな～んの意味もないんちゃうの？
english: The container may be the best in Japan, but if the contents are third class, then isn't it completely meaningless?

japanese: いえ、これは秘宝ですから。わたくしたちもこの度、初めて見たのです。
english: No, it's a national treasure, you see. This is the first time we've seen it as well.

japanese: いえ、お気になさらず。郷に入っては郷に従えと学んできました。
english: No, please don't concern yourself. I have learnt to do as the Romans when in Rome.

japanese: いいのよ。いままで実のないブランド品を高く売りつけて暴利をむさぼってきたんだから。今後せいぜい良心的な商売にはげめばいいんだわ。
english: Never mind that. After all, up till now he's been stuffing himself on huge profits, selling brand-name goods of no real worth at high prices. From now on, he can just try his best at honest trade.

japanese: いいか。店内では大人しくしてるんだぞ。
english: OK, you keep quiet while we're in the store.

japanese: あんな妹達でよければ、ノシをつけてさしあげますよ。
english: If those little brats of sisters are good enough I'll make a gift of them to you!

japanese: い、いっつも食べ物で懐柔されるとは、限りませんからねっ。
english: Don't think you'll always be able to placate me with food!

japanese: あんな本みたらフツーの女は引くもんな！
english: Obviously a normal woman would lose interest if she saw a book like that!

japanese: あんな二股かける女なんか忘れたわ、ボケ。
english: Idiot, I've forgotten that two-timing bitch.

japanese: アンタ本当に器用ねっ。主夫とか向いてるんじゃない？
english: You're really handy, aren't you? Don't you think you'd make a good house-husband?

japanese: あんたは男としてってゆうか人間として最低だ～！！
english: As a man, no a human being, you're the pits!

japanese: あんたは世話の焼けるひとだね。
english: You're a troublesome person!

japanese: アンケートの集計は、表計算ソフトで行っていましたが、最近は、データベースソフトでの集計の方が容易な気がして、データベースソフトで集計しています。
english: We used to compile survey results using spreadsheet programs but recently we feel that database software's summing methods are quicker so we use databases to total them.

japanese: あれはさる年に因んだ猿の絵です。
english: That's a picture of a monkey associated with the Year of the Monkey.

japanese: あれは朝にラブホから出るのを目撃されるかのごとく気まずかった。
english: That was as awkward as being seen coming out of a love hotel in the morning.

japanese: アレが痛いんですよ、アレが。んー、何て言うの？コーガン？とにかく、男性の大事なものです。
english: Down there hurts, down there. Er, what do you call them? Testicles? In any case a male's 'important parts'.

japanese: あれ？何だろ？パフォーマンスでもやってるのか？
english: Hello, what's that? Somebody doing street theatre or something?

japanese: あれ？この曲・・・。プレイリストが一周してるな。
english: Eh? This tune ... The playlist has looped.

japanese: アルコールが酸化するとアルデヒドとなりますが、アルデヒドが酸化するとどうなりますか。
english: If you oxidise an alcohol you get an aldehyde but what do you get if you oxidise an aldehyde?

japanese: アルカリは酸を中和する。
english: Alkalis neutralize acids.

japanese: あらまあ、馬子にも衣装とはこのことだねぇ。スーツ着ると結構格好いいじゃん。
english: Well, it's just like the proverb "fine feathers make a fine bird". You look really good when you wear a suit.

japanese: あら、あまり興味なかったはずなのに、どういう風の吹き回しかな。
english: Really? You didn't show much interest before. I wonder what's got into you?

japanese: アメリカは発表するたびに、イラク軍のゲリラ抵抗を「テロ」と呼んでおります。
english: In reports in America, guerrilla resistance by the Iraq military is called terrorism.

japanese: アメリカの尻馬に乗るなというセリフに正面から反論するのが、どれほどしんどいことだったことか。
english: Just how tiresome was it to argue straight against the phrase "Don't blindly follow America's lead!"

japanese: アメフトでタッチダウンは６点になる。
english: In American football, a touchdown scores six points.

japanese: アマゾン川は延々と北ブラジルを流れている。
english: The Amazon River meanders through northern Brazil.

japanese: アマゾン・ドット・コムで本を注文しました。
english: I've ordered a book from Amazon.com.

japanese: あの方にくれぐれもよろしく。
english: Give him my best regards.

japanese: あの二人、元に戻すつもりなんて更々ないみたいだし・・・。
english: It seems they don't have the slightest intention of restoring it.

japanese: あの大名は十万石を領している。

english: To say that it gives the impression of a cheap toy is unfair to cheap toys.

japanese: 「ちがうちがう僕らは求めてる笑顔はあんなじゃない」　それは『嗤い』もしくは『嘲笑』。
english: "No, no! That isn't the smiling face we are looking for." It was a 'smirk' either that or a 'sneer'.

japanese: 「だ、大丈夫？怪我してない？」オズオズと聞いてみる。「あ、うん、大丈夫」
english: "Y-You OK? Not hurt?", I enquire timidly. "Ah, no, I'm fine."

japanese: 「そんなに性格がいいかな～？」「ありえない。今回もだけど、中学ん時は女子のパンツを売りさばいて儲けてたし」
english: "Do I really have that good a personality?" "Impossible. After all, there's this time as well, but in middle school you sold off girl's pants all over to bring in the money."

japanese: 「それを乗り越えて、初めて少年は男にうんちゃらかんちゃらです」「何となくよさげな事を言おうってんなら、最後までちゃんと言えよ！」
english: "It is when you overcome that, that a boy becomes something-something" "If you're trying to say something important sounding keep talking right to the end!"

japanese: 「それよりそのカッコ・・・水着！？」「そうよ。イケてるでしょー！？ムラムラする～？」
english: "Never mind that, what's with that get up ... a swimming suit!?" "That's right. Sexy isn't it? Feeling horny?"

japanese: 「それは糖分を供給してもっと働けと暗に……？」「はい？」「いや、ちょとやさぐれてるだけ。ごめん」
english: "Is that implying that I go get some sugar in me and then work more?" "Er?" "No, sorry. I'm just sulking a bit."

japanese: 「その人なんて言ってたんスか？」「露語が全く通じなかったので露語でなじってやった」
english: "What was that person saying?" "He couldn't communicate in Russian at all so I told him off in Russian."

japanese: 「そっか。暇なら掃除しといて」「なんだそれ。兄貴をアゴで使うなよ」
english: "Oh? If you're free get the cleaning done." "What's up with that? Don't order your brother around!"

japanese: 「そうね、たしかに今日の春樹ちゃんは乗ってなかった感じ」「げ。そういうのって分かるのか？」
english: "You're right, certainly you don't seem to have been into it today." "Eh! You can tell that sort of thing?"

japanese: 「そうそう。せめて２階にも増やして欲しい・・・ってなんでお前がここにいる！？」「なんでって、そんなん決まってるやんか。一緒に連れションするためや」
english: "I know, right? The least they could do is put one on the second floor, too... Wait a mo! Why are you following me!?" "The 'why' is pretty obvious, don't you think? We're going to the bathroom together."

japanese: 「そうか。やはり私のほうが年を食ってる。私は今年で２０うんたら才だ」「いや、わかんねーよ」
english: "Oh? Then, as I expected, I've been around longer than you. This year I'm 20-mumble years old." "What does that tell me?"

japanese: 「じゃんけんね」「ぐー」「ちょ・・パー」「後出しかよ！」
english: "Rock-paper-scissors, OK?" "Rock." "Sciss... paper." "You cheated!"

japanese: 「じゃあ、チェックしちゃいますね」「審査宜しく。頑張ったつもりだぜ」
english: "Right, I'll check your work, OK?" "Please go ahead and inspect. I think I gave it a good go."

japanese: 「しまった！傘を電車に忘れた」「あわてん坊ね」
english: "Oh no! I left my umbrella on the train." "You are a scatterbrain!"

japanese: 「こんな朝早くから開館してるんですか？」「私は顔パスよ」
english: "Will they be open this early in the morning?" "They'll let me in on sight."

japanese: 「これは・・・」「軍手とスコップ。園芸部基本道具のひとつだよ」
english: "This is ..." "Working glove and trowel. One of a gardening club's basic tools."

japanese: 「この髪型にしてもらえますか？」「前髪を短く、横は長めにお願いします」
english: "Can you cut it like this, please?" "A little shorter in the front and a little longer on the sides, please."

japanese: 「このたびはご愁傷さまでございます」とひとことお悔みの挨拶をします。
english: Use a brief expression of condolence, such as: "On this sad occasion we grieve with you".

japanese: 「ここまでは表向きの話なんです。キリカさんも知っていることですね」「ってことは、裏向きもあるんですか？」
english: "Up to this point has been the official story, which Kirika also knows." "By which you mean there is also an unofficial?"

japanese: 「ここって・・・蝉の声が東京と違う」「あらまっ、よく気がついたこと。貴女、良い音感してるわよ」
english: "Here ... the sound of the cicadas is different." "Oh my, I'm impressed you noticed. You've got a good sense of pitch!"

japanese: 「けんじが病院に？」「そうや、ほんまけったくそ悪い......」
english: "Kenji's in the hospital?" "That's a real pisser..."

japanese: 「きれいな宝石ですね」、適当な話題かどうかわからないが、とりあえずそう水を向けてみた。
english: "Pretty gem, isn't it?" Not knowing if it was a suitable subject or not, but anyway I tried to get her interest that way.

japanese: 「キツネの嫁入りですね」「はぁ？」「今日は81パーセントの確率で晴れますが、ところによっては天気雨です」
english: "It'll be a 'fox's wedding'." "Huh?" "There's an eighty-one percent chance of sun today with sun showers in a few places."

japanese: 「カイちゃんよー、お姉ちゃんはスゴク悲しいよー。こんなことで人生初体験だよ」「え？」「夜・逃・げ」
english: "Kai dear! I'm really sad! Having my first experience in this way." "Eh?" "Skip-ping-town."

japanese: 「おとこ」と付けると商品はブレイクする。
english: Add "Men" and the goods take off.

japanese: 「おしっこしたい」「ジョニー、そうじゃないだろ。『すみません。お手洗いにいきたいんですが』と言いなさい」
english: "I have to pee." "Jonny, that's not the right thing to say. Say, 'Excuse me. I need to go to the toilet.'"

japanese: 「おかしいよね。予定では今頃みんなＵＦＯを目撃して、一丸となって研究してるはずだったんだけどさ」「目撃からしてアリエネー」
english: "Strange isn't it. By the schedule around now we should have all witnessed an UFO, and united in researching." "From 'witnessed' it's never gunna happen."

japanese: 成歩堂先生の事務所が「エネルギー分野における世界有数の法律事務所」である。
english: Mr. Naruhodo's law firm is "The World's Leading Energy Law Firm".

japanese: 「ええと、その合コンというのはつまり・・・」「普通のコンパだよ」
english: "Er, that 'mixer party' thing is then ..." "Just a normal get together."

japanese: 「うん、ビスクドールの様なエリカさん」「そ、その表現は少し気恥ずかしいから止めてくれない？」
english: "Yes, the bisque-doll-like Erika" "Th-that expression is a little embarrassing, could you stop using it?"

japanese: 「うちの愛妻がケチでさー」「のろけてる？愚痴ってる？」
english: "My wonderful wife is so stingy that ..." "You boasting? Or complaining?"

japanese: 「いいから金払えっての」「さっさとマネーよこせネ」
english: "Just pay up already, I'm saying." "Hand over the money, Yo!"

japanese: 「あれが生徒会長？」「かっこよくない？」「つーか、美形？」
english: "That's the new head of the student council?" "Cool, isn't he?" "Rather, pretty boy?"

japanese: 「あれ？恵子は？」「今日は三者面談だから遅れるって」
english: "Eh? Where's Keiko?" "Said she's got a parent and child meeting so she'll be late."

japanese: 「あの方とあなたのご関係はどうなのですか」「私は彼の父です」
english: "What is your relationship to him?" "I'm his father."

japanese: 「あの６人はどこ行った？」「エスケープしまた」
english: "Where have those six got to?" "They've escaped."

japanese: 「あっ。あたし生卵！」「一個でいいですか？」「うん。足りなくなったらまた注ぎ足すから」
english: "Ah, a raw egg for me!" "Is one enough?" "Yep, if I need more I'll top it up."

japanese: 「１日８時間、週４０時間」という労働基準法が定める労働時間の規制を特定のホワイトカラーだけ除外する「ホワイトカラー・エグゼンプション」の議論が進んでいる。
english: The argument continues about the "white-collar exemption" that exempts specific white-collar workers from the "eight hours per day, 40 hours per week" working hours, as fixed by labour standards legislation.

japanese: 「・・・つまり、セックス！？」「うわあ、健二ったら・・・みもふたもない」
english: "... in other words, sex!?" "Geez, you don't beat around the bush!"

japanese: 鯔背だね。
english: He's looking good.

japanese: （注）画像がリンク切れになっている場合があります。
english: NB: Pictures may have become dead links.

japanese: 騙されやすい人はたえず生れてくるといった人があるが、詐欺師は、いずれも、このことを承知している。
english: It has been said that "a sucker's born every minute" and every 'confidence man' knows it.

japanese: 頷いたり、手を叩いたり、ほほえんだり、また、爆笑したりして承認を伝える。
english: People communicate approval by nodding, by clapping their hands, by smiling or laughing.

japanese: 雹が降るのを見たことがありますか。
english: Have you ever seen it hail?

japanese: 雹が降っています。
english: It's hailing.

japanese: 雉も鳴かずば打たれまい。
english: The pheasant would not be shot but for its cries.

japanese: 隕石が燃えて、流星となる。
english: A burning meteoroid produces a meteor.

japanese: 近いうちに嵐になりそうだ。
english: It seems that there will be a storm soon.

japanese: 軈て幽霊は濃い霧の中に消えた。
english: Before long, the ghost disappeared into a thick fog.

japanese: やがて万物は死に絶えます。
english: All things die in time.

japanese: 跪いてあの娘に頼んだよ。
english: And I begged her on my bended knees.

japanese: 贅沢品の市場は急速に成長している。
english: The market for luxury goods is growing fast.

japanese: 贅沢な暮らしをしたい。
english: I would like to live in luxury.

japanese: 贅沢な趣味のため、彼女は収入の範囲内でやっていくことができませんでした。
english: With her extravagant tastes, she was incapable of making ends meet.

japanese: 蝙蝠は鳥ではなく哺乳類だ。
english: A bat is not a bird, but a mammal.

japanese: 蜃気楼は幻影だと言われている。
english: A mirage is said to be an illusion.

japanese: 藪をつついてヘビを出す。
english: It's not good to wake a sleeping snake.

japanese: 艱難汝を玉にす。
english: Adversity makes a man wise, not rich.

japanese: 腱鞘炎ではないかと思うのです。
english: I think I have tendonitis.

japanese: 肛門のまわりに湿疹があります。
english: I have a rash around my anus.

japanese: 羹に懲りて膾を吹く
english: A burnt child dreads the fire.

japanese: 籠の鳥に水とえさをまいにちやるようにしてください。
english: Please see that the birds in the cage get water and food every day.

japanese: 籠の中のリンゴの数を数えなさい。
english: Count the apples in the basket.

japanese: 籠の中で鳥が鳴いていますね。
english: There's a bird singing in the cage, isn't there?

japanese: 瞼が大きく開く。
english: An eyelid opens wide.

japanese: 爬虫類が大嫌い。
english: I can't stand reptiles.

japanese: 漱石は鴎外と同時代の人であった。
english: Soseki was a contemporary of Ohgai.

japanese: 浣腸をしました。
english: I gave him an enema.

japanese: 檻の中で飼われると子どもを産まない動物もいる。
english: Some animals will not breed when kept in cages.

japanese: 檻に入れられた虎は盛んに尾を振った。
english: The caged tiger lashed its tail.

japanese: 旱魃は食糧不足を招いた。
english: The drought led to an insufficiency of food.

japanese: 撥ね付けられるほどに増すわが思い。
english: The more she spurns my love, the more it grows.

japanese: 扁桃腺がはれている気がするのですが。
english: I'm afraid my tonsils are swollen.

japanese: 彗星は運行しながら後ろに光の尾を引く。
english: The comet leaves a trail of light behind it as it moves.

japanese: 屁理屈ばかり並べて、お前の言ってること全然筋が通ってないよ。
english: All you do is string together a bunch of farfetched ideas. I can't understand a word of it.

japanese: 放射線を大量に浴びたら、すぐに嘔吐と下痢が始まります。
english: After being exposed to a large amount of radiation, vomiting and diarrhea will start quickly.

japanese: 嗅覚は五感の一つである。
english: Smell is one of the five senses.

japanese: 嗅覚は鋭いです。
english: I have a good sense of smell.

japanese: 嗅覚が鈍っています。
english: I've lost my sense of smell.

japanese: 喘息の発作が起きました。
english: I had an asthma attack.

japanese: 腕時計はどこにも見つからなかった。
english: The watch was not to be found anywhere.

japanese: 腕時計の収集が趣味だ。
english: The collection of wristwatches is a hobby.

japanese: 犬が腕時計と扇子を食った。
english: The dog ate a watch and a Japanese fan.

japanese: 腕時計が見つからないんです。
english: I can't find my watch.

japanese: 腕を離せ。人に触れられるのにはがまんがならんのだ。
english: Let go of my arm! I can't stand people touching me.

japanese: 腕を放してよ。痛いわ。
english: Please let go of my arm. You're hurting me.

japanese: 腕を放して。
english: Let go of my arm!

japanese: 腕を放してくれませんか。
english: Would you please let go of my arm?

japanese: 腕を放してくれ。
english: Let go of my arm.

japanese: 腕を前後に振りなさい。
english: Swing your arm back and forth.

japanese: 腕を骨折しました。
english: I fractured my arm.

japanese: 腕を蚊にさされているのに気づきませんでした。
english: I was not aware of a mosquito biting my arm.

japanese: 腕をまっすぐ伸ばしなさい。
english: Stretch your arms straight.

japanese: 腕をふるって料理をしましょう。
english: I'll try my hand at cooking.

japanese: 腕の傷は跡を残した。
english: The wound in the arm left a scar.

japanese: 腕のいい工芸師は自分の作品に誇りを持っている。
english: A good craftsman takes pride in his work.

japanese: 腕が痛む。
english: I have an ache in my arm.

japanese: 湾岸戦争についてどう思いますか。
english: How do you feel about the Gulf War?

japanese: 湾岸諸国は常に戦争の脅威にさらされている。
english: Gulf nations are constantly menaced by war.

japanese: 湾にはたくさんのボートと人がいる。
english: The bay is full of boats and people.

japanese: 湾にはセーリングボートよりヨットがたくさんある。
english: The bay has more yachts than sailboats.

japanese: 藁なしで煉瓦はできない。
english: You cannot make bricks without straw.

japanese: 鷲の羽は広げると１メーターにもなる。
english: An eagle's wings are more than one meter across.

japanese: 鷲が一羽空高く飛んでいた。
english: An eagle was soaring high up in the air.

japanese: 枠が出来上がると、クモはちょうど自転車の車輪のやのように、それに絹の糸をかける。
english: When the frame is finished, the spider fixes lines of silk across it, just like the spokes of a bicycle wheel.

japanese: 惑星は太陽の周囲を回転する。
english: The planets revolve around the sun.

japanese: 惑星は恒星の周りを回る。
english: Planets move around a fixed star.

japanese: 惑星の表面はほとんどが水から出来ている。
english: The surface of a planet is composed mostly of water.

japanese: 脇腹が少し痛い。
english: I have a slight pain in my side.

japanese: 脇へ寄ってくださいませんか。
english: Would you mind standing aside?

japanese: 脇によってください。
english: Please step aside.

japanese: 脇の下に汗をかいた。
english: I perspired under the arms.

japanese: 脇でいろいろ言わないでくれよ。
english: Don't be a backseat driver.

japanese: 賄賂を受け取ったのですか、それとも受け取らなかったのですか。
english: Did you or did you not accept the bribe?

japanese: 話題を変えましょう。
english: Let's change the subject.

japanese: 話題は多様多種だった。
english: We talked about a variety of topics.

japanese: 話上手もいれば、聞き上手もいる。
english: Some people are good talkers and others good listeners.

japanese: 話を聞かせてくれ。
english: I want a full report though.

japanese: 話すのを聞いて初めて彼だとわかった。
english: It wasn't until I heard him speak that I recognized him.

japanese: 話を楽しんでいる。
english: We enjoy talking.

japanese: 話をやめてくれませんか。
english: Will you stop talking?

japanese: 話をつけようじゃないか。
english: Let's talk it out.

japanese: 話をする前に手を挙げて下さい。
english: Please raise your hand before you speak.

japanese: 話をそらすなよ。
english: Don't change the subject.

japanese: 話をして時間をつぶした。
english: We talked our time away.

japanese: 話をさえぎらないでください。
english: Please don't cut me off like that.

japanese: 話は腹を抱えて笑うほどおかしかった。
english: The story was so funny that I split my sides.

japanese: 話は多岐にわたった。
english: We talked about various topics.

japanese: 話は語っても全然減らない。
english: A tale never loses in the telling.

japanese: 話は三時までだらだらと続いた。
english: The talk dragged on till three o'clock.

japanese: 話は決まった。
english: Let's leave it at that.

japanese: 話は遠い昔に始まる。
english: The story begins far in the past.

japanese: 話はかわりますが。
english: To change the subject.

japanese: 話の焦点は内容に置かれている。
english: The focus of the talk is put on the content.

japanese: 話では腹は張らぬ。
english: The belly is not filled with fair words.

japanese: 話せば長いことなのです。
english: It is a long story.

japanese: 話すのは簡単だが、実行の困難な事は多くある。
english: Many things are easy to talk about, but difficult to actually carry out.

japanese: 話すことを学んでいる子どもは学ぶわけではない。
english: It isn't as if a child learning to talk studies.

japanese: 話すことは人間の能力の一つである。
english: Talking is a human ability.

japanese: 小さな声でも話すな。まして、大きな声で話すなど、もってのほかだ。
english: Don't whisper, let alone speak.

japanese: 話すことと書くことは別物だ。
english: To speak is one thing and to write is another.

japanese: 話すことが多すぎて、どこから話し始めたらいいか分からない。
english: There are so many things to tell you that I don't know where to start.

japanese: 話し方で彼だと分かる。
english: I can tell it's him by the way he speaks.

japanese: 話し方がちょっと速すぎて私には分かりません。もう少しゆっくり話していただけませんか。
english: You're speaking a little too fast for me. Would you speak a little more slowly?

japanese: 話し相手が欲しいだけです。
english: Just looking for someone to talk to.

japanese: 話し相手が欲しい。
english: I need someone to talk with.

japanese: 話し声が壁に反響してうるさいな、この部屋。
english: This room is noisy. The sound bounces right off the walls.

japanese: 話し上手といわれる人もあれば、聞き上手といわれる人もいる。
english: Some are called good talkers, and others good listeners.

japanese: 話し手は例を用いてその理論を説明した。
english: The speaker illustrated the theory with examples.

japanese: 話し手は真実をわれわれにしみじみと悟らせた。
english: The speaker brought the truth home to us.

japanese: その話し手は話を聞いてもらえなかった。
english: The speaker couldn't make himself heard.

japanese: 話し手の周りには人だかりがしていた。
english: A crowd of people gathered around the speaker.

japanese: 話し合わねばならないことがたくさんある。
english: We have a lot of ground to cover.

japanese: 話し合う問題のリストを作って下さい。
english: Will you make a list of issues to discuss?

japanese: 話し合いはちょっと中断した。
english: There was a brief break in the discussion.

japanese: 話し合いのもとにするために、ミーティングに先立ち、皆様からいただいた提案をとりまとめてみました。
english: I have tried to compile the ideas that you proposed prior to the meeting, so that we can use them as the base for the discussion.

japanese: 話をするとすぐに口論になる。
english: They never talk but they quarrel.

japanese: 話し掛けなければ、めったに話をしない人もいる。
english: Some seldom speak unless spoken to.

japanese: 話をすることで自分を曝け出すことを恐れず、英語で他人としゃべるあらゆる機会をとらえなさい。そうすればじきに形式張らない会話の場面で気楽になれるであろう。
english: Don't be afraid to reveal yourself through speaking; take every opportunity to converse with others in English, and soon you will feel right at home in informal conversational situations.

japanese: 話しぶりから彼はアメリカ人ではないことがわかる。
english: I know from his speech that he is not an American.

japanese: 話の要点を書き留めなさい。
english: Take down the main points of the speech.

japanese: 話してもいいですか。
english: May I speak to you?

japanese: 話しているうちに、彼はだんだん興奮して来た。
english: As he talked, he got more and more excited.

japanese: 話しかけるな。
english: Don't talk to me.

japanese: 話したいことがあるのだけど。
english: I want to talk to you about something.

japanese: 話しかけられたらすぐに返事をしなさい。
english: Answer at once when spoken to.

japanese: 話しかけない限りめったに話さない人もいる。
english: Some seldom speak unless spoken to.

japanese: 話がうますぎて本当とは思えない。
english: It is too good to be true.

japanese: 話が退屈だったので彼らは一人また一人と立ち去って行った。
english: The speech was so boring that they went away one by one.

japanese: 話が進むにつれ彼の弁舌はますますさえた。
english: His speech had more and more power as it went along.

japanese: 話が合いすぎるので、かえって何か怪しいと思った。
english: The story was too pat and I got rather suspicious.

japanese: 話が違うじゃないか。
english: That's not what you said before.

japanese: 話がそれた。
english: The story wandered.

japanese: 話がちょっと途切れた。
english: There was a momentary pause in the talk.

japanese: 話がうますぎるよ。
english: That's too good to be true.

japanese: 話があるんだけど。
english: Can we talk in private?

japanese: 話があったら電話をかけて下さい。
english: If you want to speak to me, please call me up.

japanese: 和平交渉がすでに秘密裡に開始されたとのことです。
english: It is rumored that secret peace talks have already begun.

japanese: 和平会談は再度失敗したが、双方とも相手方に失敗の責任ありと非難した。
english: The peace talks failed again, with both sides blaming the other for the failure.

japanese: 和平会談は再度失敗した。
english: The peace talks failed again.

japanese: 和平会議が来週始まる。
english: Peace talks will begin next week.

japanese: 和平会談はしばらく延期された。
english: The peace talks have been suspended for a while.

japanese: 和服姿の男性は東京ではもうあまり見かけない。
english: Men in kimonos are no longer a common sight in Tokyo.

japanese: 和食を食べたことはありますか。
english: Have you ever eaten Japanese food?

japanese: 和食は好きですか。
english: Do you like Japanese food?

japanese: 和室が好きな英国人もいると言われます。
english: It is said that some British people like a Japanese-style room.

japanese: 和子さんはお姉さんによく似ています。
english: Kazuko really takes after her sister.

japanese: 彼らは仲良く一緒に暮らしている。
english: They live together in unity.

japanese: 論理学の基礎を作ったのはソクラテスである。
english: It was Socrates who laid the foundation of logic.

japanese: 論文を書き終えましたか。
english: Have you finished writing your thesis?
